Join us for Spark! A Night of Creativity on Jan. 31, 6–9 p.m.

Get ready to relive your childhood at Spark—an after-hours adventure where grown-ups get to play! Get Tickets

A New Year Means New Ways to Get Creative!

Whether you’re picking up a brush for the first time or rediscovering a favorite hobby, our classes are designed to inspire and welcome artists of all levels. Browse Classes

The Roommate live on stage Feb. 12–March 1

This funny and deeply moving play—recently seen on Broadway—examines the complexities that arise between two very different women and how they navigate changing senses of identity, relevance, and the possibility of reinvention. Get Tickets

In the Museum: Laura Sofía Pérez

Part of the Contemporary Film Series, this film is a journey through Puerto Rico’s interior to affirm the enduring presence, knowledge, and traditions of the island’s Indigenous people. Learn More

Gathering Place: Permanent Collection Reinstallation

Come explore the first comprehensive reinstallation of the museum’s permanent collection galleries in nearly a decade. Learn More

In the Museum: Open-Hearted

This exhibition examines the history, meaning, and contemporary realities of health care and well-being. Learn More

Previous Next

EXPERIENCE THE FINE ARTS CENTER

For over 100 years, the Fine Arts Center has been the top cultural attraction of the Pikes Peak region offering world-class art exhibitions, Broadway-worthy theatre, and arts education for all ages and abilities. Established in 1919 as the Broadmoor Art Academy, the FAC—now a division of Colorado College—celebrates and challenges our understanding of place, uplifts artists from the past, present, and future, and amplifies art’s capacity to shape our work and inspire new possibilities.

In the Museum 

Theatre & Performing Arts

Explore Our Free Digital Guide

Explore the Fine Arts Center’s museum with our free digital guide! Our guide offers digital access to works in our collection, including exclusive audio from curators, suggested tours, and more. Browse the guide on the web or enjoy our optimized guide on Bloomberg Connects, the free arts and culture app.

Join our mailing list to receive programming news and updates from the Fine Arts Center!

Sign up for email updates

Colorado College recognizes and honors the original inhabitants who first settled in the area and who called the nearby highest mountain “Tava,” the original name given by the Ute people to what is now known as Pikes Peak. At CC, we respect all peoples and strive to grow as a unique and welcoming community.

30 West Dale St.
Colorado Springs, CO, 80903

(719) 634-5581
